actions.text: Measure called up by unanimous consent in Senate.
Senate vitiated its action on passage.
Measure indefinitely postponed in Senate, H.R. 11510 passed in lieu.

official_title: A bill to provide for starling and blackbird control in Kentucky and Tennessee.

summary.text: Declares that large concentrations of starlings, grackles, blackbirds, and other birds in Kentucky and Tennessee pose a hazard to public health and safety. Declares that an emergency exists requiring immediate action with insufficient time for compliance with the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969. Authorizes the Secretary of the Interior, upon certification by the Governor, of either or both States, to treat roosts with greater than 500,000 birds with chemicals approved for bird control purposes. Declares that the provisions of the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 and the Federal Environmental Pesticide Control Act shall not apply to any such blackbird control activites undertaken by Kentucky or Tennessee on or before April 15, 1976, or by the Federal Government within those States.

titles.title: A bill to provide for starling and blackbird control in Kentucky and Tennessee.
